intro: Begonia corneri, commonly known as the Cape Verde begonia, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and deep green color. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sought-after species among plant enthusiasts.
